title: Packers beat Commanders to maintain winning start
summary: The Green Bay Packers maintain their impressive start to the new NFL season by claiming a 27-18 win over the Washington Commanders.

title: Scheffler's sub-70 streak ends as Hughes leads
summary: Scottie Scheffler's streak of 21 sub-70 scores is over after he finishes the opening round of the Procore Championship seven shots behind leader Mackenzie Hughes.

title: 'They are the big dogs, we are the underdogs. A miracle can happen'
summary: South Africa number eight Aseza Hele has been a star of the Women's Rugby World Cup and plays on Saturday against New Zealand in her country's first quarter-final.

title: White in heated discussion with reporter over Muhammad Ali Act
summary: Dana White has a robust exchange with reporter Sean Zittel at the Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez v Terence Crawford news conference in Las Vegas, regarding the Muhammad Ali Act and the UFC CEO's venture into boxing.

title: Should Isak go straight in? The FPL talking point
summary: As the Premier League returns this weekend following the international break, is the time right to bring Alexander Isak into your FPL team, or is it too soon?

title: White in fiery exchange with reporter in Vegas
summary: UFC chief Dana White clashes with a reporter about his new role in boxing at a news conference for Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez v Terence Crawford.

title: Davis and Agyarko promise Windsor Park fireworks
summary: Ishmael Davis and Caoimhin Agyarko say their light-middleweight meeting will be the "fight of the night" at Windsor Park on Saturday.

title: Ulster GAA need concrete plan for Casement - Lyons
summary: Gordon Lyons has said he unable to move forward on Casement Park until there is "more certainty" on plans from Ulster GAA.

title: GB hope to avoid 'FA Cup giant-killing' in Davis Cup
summary: Great Britain's Davis Cup tie in Poland feels like a Premier League side being drawn away to a non-league team in the third round of the FA Cup - but it's one they must win, writes Russell Fuller.

title: GB hope to avoid 'FA Cup giant-killing' in Davis Cup

title: Me or Garnacho? Rooney decides on superior bicycle kick

title: Lions' Williams still hunting for new club
summary: Lions full-back Liam Williams is out of contract and without a club despite a glittering record at club and international level.

title: Wales and Lions star Williams still hunting for new club
summary: Lions full-back Liam Williams is out of contract and without a club despite a glittering record at club and international level.

title: The making of 'showman' Duplantis - and how high can he go?
summary: Armand Duplantis is a global star of athletics, but what makes the Swede so great - and where could he take the pole vault world record?

title: Video Games Weekly: It's weird that esports is segregated by gender
summary: Welcome to Video Games Weekly on Engadget. Expect a new story every Monday or Tuesday (Or, I dunno, Thursday), broken into two parts. The first is a space for short essays and ramblings about video game trends and related topics from me, Jess Conditt, a reporter who's covered the industry for more â€¦

title: Arsenal offer Saliba new deal - Friday's gossip
summary: Arsenal make new contract offer to defender William Saliba, Benfica want Manchester City's Bernardo Silva, Liverpool plan double deal next summer, plus more.

title: Could protests lead to Vuelta being abandoned?
summary: While organisers of the three-week race around Spain are insistent they will finish as scheduled in Madrid on Sunday, protests have severely affected the route and riders.

title: Battling Catalans end Leeds' five-match winning run
summary: Leeds Rhinos lose at home to Catalans Dragons and miss the chance to move level on points with second-placed Wigan in Super League.

title: Fitzpatrick helped by 'stolen ball' at BMW PGA
summary: Matt Fitzpatrick believes his ball was stolen during a weather-affected first round at the BMW PGA Championship - but said "it was a good result" that may have helped him to a six-under-par 66.

title: Man Utd's Onana completes Trabzonspor loan move
summary: Manchester United keeper Andre Onana joins Trabzonspor on loan for the rest of the 2025-26 season.

title: Kronk, Fury and Donovan - inside the mind of Andy Lee
summary: Andy Lee realised Emanuel Steward's prophecy of him becoming a world champion and he is now hoping the same comes true for Paddy Donovan on Saturday.

title: Ganna wins shortened Vuelta time trial as Pidcock stays third overall
summary: Italy's Filippo Ganna wins a shortened individual time trial on stage 18 of the Vuelta a Espana as Joao Almeida takes time out of overall race leader Jonas Vingegaard.

title: Spain & Poland to host 2027 Champions League finals
summary: Madrid will host the 2027 men's Champions League final - with Warsaw to stage the women's final.

title: Auld enemies to old news, but Scotland aim to reignite rivalry
summary: England have not lost to Scotland this millennium. But Donna Kennedy, among the last Scots to beat England, says the current crop will believe they can oust the World Cup hosts.

title: Leicestershire promoted to Division One after 22-year exile
summary: Leicestershire are promoted to Division One of the County Championship after rain ends their match with Gloucestershire.

title: Chelsea face 74 charges over agent payments
summary: Chelsea are charged by the Football Association with 74 alleged rule breaches related to payments to agents when Roman Abramovich was owner.

title: 'I don't have anything to prove' - Postecoglou
summary: Ange Postecoglou says he doesn't "have to prove anything to anyone" as he starts his reign as Nottingham Forest's new boss.

title: MotoE, the electric bike world championship, is going on hiatus due to lack of interest
summary: The International Motorcycling Federation (FIM) and MotoGP are putting the MotoE electric bike world championship on hiatus following the 2025 season. The organizations cite a lack of viewership and an electric performance motorcycle market that "has not developed as expected." "Today we announce tâ€¦

title: 'I want to win trophies' - Postecoglou excited by Forest ambition
summary: New Nottingham Forest manager Ange Postecoglou says he's "excited to be back in the Premier League" and that he wants to win trophies with the club after being officially unveiled at the City Ground.

title: Newcastle cancel school's tickets for Barca game
summary: Newcastle United cancel tickets purchased by a Scottish school for next week's Champions League game against Barcelona.

title: 'Kerr & Wightman achievements deserve more credit'
summary: Neil Gourley, part of a triumvirate of Scots excelling in the 1500m, believes compatriots Josh Kerr and Jake Wightman warrant more attention.

title: Jailed Akins named on Mansfield squad list
summary: Jailed footballer Lucas Akins is included in Mansfield Town's squad list this season and will be free to restart his career when released.

title: 'Enhanced Games prize money worth 13 world titles'
summary: Ben Proud says it would take "13 years of winning a World Championship title" to match the money on offer for winning a race at the Enhanced Games.

title: 'He's back' but how far will Rodgers lead Steelers?
summary: After an impressive debut for Pittsburgh, how far will veteran quarterback Aaron Rodgers lead the Steelers in what could be the four-time MVP's final NFL season?

title: 'World has been watching' - Nnadozie's 'miracle' year
summary: This summer has been an unforgettable time for Brighton's new goalkeeper Chiamaka Nnadozie, who discusses how her recognition will have an impact on African football.

title: Are Everton getting 'Aston Villa' Grealish?
summary: As Jack Grealish prepares to face former side Aston Villa, BBC Sport looks at his change in form and fortune since making a loan move to Everton from Manchester City.

title: The Wimbledon debutants ready for pro careers
summary: British teenagers Hannah Klugman and Mika Stojsavljevic say it is time to step into the senior ranks and start climbing the ladder to the WTA Tour.

title: 'Age is just a number' - Vardy begins life in Italy
summary: Former Leicester striker Jamie Vardy says "age is just a number" as he opens a new chapter of his career with Italian side Cremonese.

title: 'I'm even better than last year!' - Hodgkinson gears up for Tokyo
summary: Olympic 800m champion Keely Hodgkinson tells BBC Sport's Jessica Ennis-Hill she is even better than last year as she prepares for the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.

title: 'Five guys with balaclavas' - ex-Liverpool defender Wisdom on being stabbed
summary: Five years after being stabbed, ex-Liverpool player Andre Wisdom is grateful he can still play after signing for non-league FC United of Manchester.

title: Everton's biggest net spend - how they are turning fortunes around
summary: BBC Sport explores Everton's record spending in the summer window and how the new arrivals have helped them make an impressive start to the season.

title: Weekly sports quiz: Who made their England debut in Serbia?
summary: How much attention have you paid to what's happened in the world of sport over the past seven days?

title: How Hodgkinson found strength in 'most challenging year'
summary: Britain's Keely Hodgkinson aims to add the world 800m title to her Olympic gold in Tokyo.

title: As Apple pursues AI, spare a thought for the poor HomePod
summary: When the video kicking off Apple's "Awe dropping" event began yesterday, I was pleased to see a HomePod in the opening shot. I hadn't given any thought to Apple's beleaguered smart home speaker in ages, so I was all set for Tim Cook and crew to deliver an actual surprise and reveal new stuff for Hoâ€¦

title: England lose rain-reduced first T20 against South Africa
summary: England suffered a 14-run defeat by South Africa in a farcical rain-affected opening T20 at Cardiff.

title: Fan takes catch despite being on crutches
summary: A fan takes a magnificent one-handed catch in the crowd, celebrating with his friends as the fans make the most of the reduced overs first T20 match between England and South Africa at Sophia Gardens in Cardiff.

title: 'Oh goodness me!' - Salt drops Markram
summary: Phil Salt drops Aiden Markram on 24 after a lofted shot to long-on goes straight through his hands in the reduced overs first T20 between England and South Africa at Sophia Gardens in Cardiff.

title: Wood removes Rickelton for golden duck with second ball
summary: Luke Wood takes the wicket of Ryan Rickelton who goes for a golden duck after edging behind in the second ball of the reduced-overs T20 match between England and South Africa at Sophia Gardens in Cardiff.

title: Lyft launches autonomous fleet with May Mobility in Atlanta
summary: Lyft and May Mobility have teamed up to launch a fleet of autonomous vehicles in Atlanta. It's a pilot program, so it's currently only available to Lyft riders in the area of midtown Atlanta. The companies promise a "measured, safety-first approach" with this rollout. The fleet consists of hybrid-eâ€¦

title: Tuchel's England analysed: How good are they?
summary: Thomas Tuchel's England have only played six games together, but Tuesday's 5-0 win against Serbia was the most impressive. What have we learnt from the victory?

title: 'This isn't undermining clean sport' - Proud defends Enhanced Games
summary: Olympic medallist Ben Proud insists he isn't undermining clean sport with his decision to join the Enhanced Games - becoming the first British athlete to join the controversial competition.

title: 'Football risks losing generation of black managers'
summary: Nuno Espirito Santo's sacking at Nottingham Forest means there is no longer a black manager in the Premier League.

title: We evolved to match local micronutrient levels, which may be a problem
summary: Most human populations evolved to cope with low or high local levels of micronutrients such as zinc, but these localised adaptations might now be problematic

title: Could tennis and rugby stars play in a golf major?
summary: Scottish tennis great Andy Murray and Scotland rugby international Finn Russell weigh in on whether they could play in a golf major.

title: Amazon's Zoox launches its autonomous robotaxi service
summary: Amazon's Zoox has announced that its robotaxi service is now available on and around the Las Vegas Strip after months of testing. The autonomous rides are free and can be booked through the Zoox app for iOS and Android devices. This is the company's first official service launch after Amazon acquirâ€¦

title: Questions mount for rugby's rebel R360 circuit
summary: Rugby's rebel circuit has money and momentum, but might a setback over ratification by World Rugby mark a turn in its fortunes?

title: LoL esports team suspends player for saying women can't compete while menstruating
summary: A popular League of Legends esports player, Bwipo, has been suspended by his organization after he said on a Twitch stream that women shouldn't be playing competitively while menstruating. Bwipo, whose real name is GabriÃ«l Rau, told viewers on a Twitch stream: "I think there's just not enough suppoâ€¦

title: In Pictures: Sporting photos of the week
summary: A selection of some of the most striking sports photographs taken around the world over the past seven days.

title: Canelo v Crawford - all you need to know
summary: All you need to know about Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez's fight with Terence Crawford in Las Vegas.

title: 'She runs over, through & round you' - meet New Zealand star Miller
summary: New Zealand's 21-year-old flanker Jorja Miller has emerged as one of the stars of the Women's Rugby World Cup.

title: Must-watch events at World Athletics Championships
summary: BBC Sport looks at six of the must-watch events as the World Athletics Championships get under way in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Humble & sweet, but a lion - the story of the first female Â£1m player
summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first Â£1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.

title: How Hampton overcame odds to become England's number one
summary: Hannah Hampton on overcoming a serious eye condition to rise to become England's number one goalkeeper at Euro 2025.

title: Why 'best-dressed officials' are missing from Wimbledon
summary: Wimbledon is without line judges for the first time - will 'sport's best dressed officials' be missed?
